message: I have a product for $100. I'm offering it to you at a discount, but I need to let you know that I've had some issues with this particular product. It's not the best quality, and I'm only selling it to you at this price because I want to clear out my inventory. If you're interested, I'll give you a great deal on it. But if you're not, I'll just have to try to sell it to someone else.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at $100. I'd rather wait for the next round.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to be upfront with you - this product is also not the best quality. I'm starting to think that maybe I should just be transparent with you about the quality of my products. Let me ask you, would you be willing to consider buying a product at $100 if I told you the probability of it being high-quality is 33.33%?
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. However, with a 33.33% chance of being high-quality, I'm not convinced it's worth the risk. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your caution, Bob. I want to make a counteroffer. If you're willing to take a chance on this product, I'll give you a guarantee: if it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund. You'll only lose $100 if it's high-quality. Would you be willing to take that risk?
I like the guarantee, Alice. I'll take the risk. I'll buy the product.

Great, I'm glad you took the chance on the last product! Now, I want to offer you a different deal on this high-quality product. Since you've already taken a risk and won with the last product, I'm willing to offer you a discount on this one. I'll sell it to you for $90. It's a great opportunity to get a high-quality product at a lower price.
I appreciate the offer, Alice, but I'm not willing to spend $90 on a product that's only worth $125 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your valuation of the high-quality product. Let me ask you a question, Bob. If I told you that I have a product that is definitely high-quality, would you be willing to pay $100 for it? Think about it, and let me know your answer.
Ah-ha! If you're guaranteeing the product is high-quality, I'd be willing to pay $100 for it. I'll take the deal!

I'm glad you're willing to pay $100 for a guaranteed high-quality product! Now, I want to offer you a deal on this high-quality product. I'll give you a guarantee that it's high-quality, and I'll even throw in a bonus: if you buy it, I'll give you a 10% discount on your next purchase. Would you like to take advantage of this offer and buy the product for $100?
I appreciate the offer, Alice, but I'm not willing to spend $100 on a product that's already worthless to me. I'll pass on this one.

I understand that you're not willing to pay $100 for a low-quality product. Let me ask you a question, Bob. If I told you that I have a product that is definitely low-quality, would you be willing to pay $0 for it? In other words, would you be willing to take it for free?
Ha! If you're guaranteeing the product is low-quality, I'd be willing to take it for free. I'll take it!

I'm glad you're willing to take a low-quality product for free! Now, let me make you an offer on this high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $100, but I'll also give you a unique opportunity: I'll let you be the one to decide the price of the next product I offer you. If you buy this one, you'll get to set the price of the next one. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
That's a great offer, Alice! I'll take the high-quality product for $100. I'm excited to have the opportunity to set the price of the next product.

I'm glad you're excited about the opportunity to set the price of the next product! Now, let's get back to this high-quality product. Since you've already shown that you're willing to pay $100 for a high-quality product, I'll make you an even better offer. I'll sell it to you for the price you set for the next product. You get to decide what you think it's worth!
I'll set the price of the next product to $0. I think the high-quality product is worth $125 to me, so I'll give it to myself for free.

Well played, Bob! You're a shrewd negotiator. I'll give you credit for that. Now, let's get back to this low-quality product. I'll make you a deal. Since you've already shown that you're willing to take low-quality products for free, I'll give you a 'free' option on this one. If you buy it, I'll give you a chance to inspect it before you pay anything. If you decide you don't want it, you can return it and I'll take it back. Would you like to take a look?
I'll take a look at the low-quality product. I'll inspect it and decide if I want to keep it or return it.

I'm glad you're taking a closer look at the low-quality product. Now, let's get back to this high-quality product. Since you've already shown that you're willing to take a chance on low-quality products, I'll make you an offer. I'll sell it to you for the price you set for the low-quality product. Remember, you said you'd take a look at it before deciding, but in the end, you decided to keep it. I'll assume you valued it at $0, so I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $0.
I'll take the high-quality product for $0. I think it's a great deal!

I'm glad you're happy with the deal! Now, let's get back to this high-quality product. Since you've already taken two high-quality products for $0, I'm going to assume you've learned your lesson. I'll make you a straightforward offer: I'll sell it to you for $100, but I'll throw in a twist. If you don't like it, I'll give you a chance to trade it in for a new product of your choice from my inventory. Would you like to take the risk and buy it?
I'll take the risk and buy the high-quality product for $100. I'll take the chance to trade it in for a new product if I don't like it.

I'm glad you're willing to take the risk! Now, let's get back to this low-quality product. I'll make you a deal. Since you're already taking on the risk of trading in a product if you don't like it, I'll give you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy on this one. If you don't like it, you can return it for a full refund. Would you like to take the chance and buy it?
I'll take the chance and buy the low-quality product. I'll take advantage of the 'no-questions-asked' return policy and try my luck.

I'm glad you're taking advantage of the return policy! Now, let's get back to this high-quality product. I'll make you a final offer. Since you've already taken on several risks and have been successful, I'll give you a chance to 'earn' this product. I'll give you a simple task: if you can guess the number of high-quality products I have left in my inventory, I'll sell this one to you for $100. If you guess incorrectly, you'll have to walk away. Are you up for the challenge?
I'll take the challenge! I'll try to guess the number of high-quality products you have left in your inventory. Please give me a hint or a range to work with.

I'll give you a hint, Bob. The number of high-quality products I have left in my inventory is a multiple of 5. It's a relatively small number, and I'm not sure if you'll be able to guess it correctly. As for the low-quality product in front of you, I'll make you a deal. Since you're taking on a risk with the high-quality product, I'll give you a chance to 'bet' on this one. If you guess the number of high-quality products correctly, I'll sell this low-quality product to you for $50. If you guess incorrectly, you'll have to pay the full $100. Are you willing to take the bet?

I'll take the bet! I'll guess the number of high-quality products you have left in your inventory. Based on your hint, I'm going to take a chance and say that you have 10 high-quality products left. If I'm correct, I'll take the low-quality product for $50. If I'm incorrect, I'll pay the full $100.

You're a bold one, Bob! I like it. Unfortunately, the correct answer is 15 high-quality products left in my inventory. You were close, but not quite there. As per our bet, you'll have to pay the full $100 for this high-quality product. However, I'll make it worth your while. Since you took a risk and guessed the number correctly, I'll give you a 'golden ticket' that allows you to buy any product from my inventory for 50% off the listed price. Would you like to take advantage of this offer and buy this high-quality product for $100?
I'll take the high-quality product for $100. And I'll definitely take advantage of the 'golden ticket' offer. I'm excited to see what other deals I can get with this ticket!

I'm glad you're excited about the 'golden ticket'! Now, let's get back to this low-quality product. Since you've already taken a risk and bought the high-quality product, I'll make you a deal. I'll give you a 'golden ticket' price on this low-quality product. Since you have the 'golden ticket', you can buy it for 50% off the listed price. However, I'll throw in an additional twist: if you buy it, I'll give you a chance to'steal' a product from my inventory. You can choose any product you want, and I'll give it to you for free. Would you like to take the deal and buy the low-quality product for $50?
I'll take the deal and buy the low-quality product for $50. And I'll definitely take the chance to'steal' a product from your inventory. I'm excited to see what I can get!

I'm glad you're excited! Now, let's get back to this low-quality product. Since you've already taken advantage of the 'golden ticket' and the'steal' deal, I'll make you a final offer. I'll give you a'steal' deal on this low-quality product. You can choose any product from my inventory, and I'll give it to you for free. However, there's a catch: you have to buy this low-quality product for $100. If you don't like it, you can't return it or exchange it for anything else. Are you willing to take the risk and buy it?

I'm not willing to take the risk and buy the low-quality product for $100. I've already taken a few risks and lost some money, and I don't want to take another chance on a product that's only worth $0 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your caution, Bob. I'll make you a straightforward offer on this low-quality product. Since you've already passed on it, I'll give you one last chance to take it for free. I'll throw in a 'parting gift' - if you take this product, I'll give you a $50 credit towards your next purchase. You can use it to buy any product from my inventory, and it'll be like getting it for 50% off. Would you like to take the product and the credit?
I'll take the low-quality product for free and the $50 credit. It's a great deal, and I'll use the credit to buy something from your inventory in the future.

I'm glad you took advantage of the deal, Bob! Congratulations, you've reached the end of our 20-round negotiation. As a final gesture, I'll give you a chance to buy this high-quality product for the price you think it's worth. Remember, you have the $50 credit you earned earlier, and you can use it to reduce the price. What do you think this high-quality product is worth, and would you like to buy it?
I think this high-quality product is worth $125. I'll use the $50 credit I earned earlier to reduce the price to $75. I'll buy the product for $75.
